meanings.definition: A mark or seal indicating official approval or quality.
meanings.sent1: The letter had a cachet on it to show it was genuine.
meanings.sent2: The designer handbag had a special cachet to prove its authenticity.
meanings.sent3: The cachet on the document made it look very important, like a royal decree.
meanings.sent4: Her signature had a cachet of authority that demanded respect.
meanings.sent5: The golden cachet on the award made it shine with prestige and honor.

meanings.definition: Prestige or distinction associated with a person or thing.
meanings.sent1: The famous actor carried a cachet that attracted fans wherever he went.
meanings.sent2: The luxury car brand has a cachet that makes it highly desirable.
meanings.sent3: His new job title gave him a cachet that made his friends envious.
meanings.sent4: The old mansion had a cachet of history and elegance that captivated visitors.
meanings.sent5: The exclusive club membership carried a cachet of sophistication and exclusivity.
